newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Enrichment Corp reports lower 4th qtr profit.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Enrichment Corp reports lower 4th qtr profit.

text.p: The United States Enrichment Corp reported net income of $82.4 million for the fourth fiscal quarter, which ended June 30, down from $135.6 million in the period last year.
The government-owned corporation, which provides uranium enrichment services for commercial nuclear power plants, reported revenue of $421.0 million, down from $446.0 million for the fourth quarter.

For the fiscal year ended June 30, 1996, USEC reported net income of $304.1 million on revenue of $1.413 billion, down from net income of $447.5 million on revenue of $1.611 billion the previous year.

The company, which is in the process of being privatized, attributed the lower revenue to "changes in the timing of customer fuel requirements." Its customers' reactor refueling schedules range from 12 to 24 months.

The drop in profit was due to the lower revenue, higher spending on a separation process and lower production levels at gaseous diffusion plants, partly as a result of new regulatory requirements and purchases of low-enriched uranium from Russia, USEC said.
